comment.narrative:
32
Management unit baselines TBD at
onset of project

59 in 2014 This score was assessed by PA staff under Prof Li Diqiangs guidance during the METT workshop in March 2015 The reasons of the improvement are that SNNR has been improving its management procedure staff capacity resource inventory and research monitoring finance comanagement etc

description.narrative: Awareness surveys among communities show increased positive attitude towards PA conservation

comment.narrative:
Baseline awareness TBD by Knowledge Attitudes Practice KAP survey at onset of project according to Participatory Rural Assessment in Qumahe Township in 2013
Angla Village 76 of interviewees were concerned for wildlife 76 of interviewees can identify at least 2 endangered species
Duoxiu Village 86 of interviewees were concerned for wildlife 80 of interviewees can identify at least 2 endangered species
Cuochi Village95 of interviewees were concerned for wildlife
Baseline 50 positive attitude

The project conducted baseline awareness assessmentKAP in 4 pilot villages of Qumahe Township in 2013 though it was not so comprehensive Environmental awareness was presented very high among the 4 pilot villages as there have been community development support extended there for several years The GEF project has also made contributions to raising awareness among local communities residing within or near PAs According to the results of MTR questionnaire interview in Duoxiu and Cuochi Villages awareness among target communities has been enhanced that about 95 of interviewees are satisfied with the GEF project knowing the comanagement agreement and benefiting to herders respectively
Baseline 50 positive attitude

The project conducted baseline awareness assessmentKAP in 4 pilot villages of Qumahe Township in 2013 though it was not so comprehensive Environmental awareness was presented very high among the 4 pilot villages as there have been community development support extended there for several years The GEF project has also made contributions to raising awareness among local communities residing within or near PAs According to the results of MTR questionnaire interview in Duoxiu and Cuochi Villages awareness among target communities has been enhanced that about 95 of interviewees are satisfied with the GEF project knowing the comanagement agreement and benefiting to herders respectively

description.narrative: Increasing PA management effectiveness through strengthened institutional and staff capacities
Annual income diverted to PA management from ecocompensation agreements excluding funds arising from the Sanjiangyuan Ecological Construction Plan

comment.narrative: gtUS10m

1589 million per year
The financial resources are from the central government excluding the Sanjiangyuan Ecological Construction Plan that is ecocompensation arrangement from the central government
According to the financial scorecard assessment the total investment to PAs was 13 million in 2014 Among which operational cost is 2514 million and infrastructure investment is 1054million which includes infrastructure conservation capacity building Research and publicity and education However rarely in road and visitor center construction If excluding the investment to SNNR the investment to other PAs is about 1589 million

description.narrative: Capacity development scorecard for the protected area system

comment.narrative: PMO and Wildlife and Nature Reserve Management Bureau conducted the midterm capacity Development Scorecard assessment The Score is 636 in May 2015 To date 17 batches of training courses with covering 11 topics were delivered to 440 trainees including 127 women288 who are from PA managers and technical staff as well as community wardens

PMO and Wildlife and Nature Reserve Management Bureau conducted the midterm capacity Development Scorecard assessment The Score is 636 in May 2015 To date 17 batches of training courses with covering 11 topics were delivered to 440 trainees including 127 women288 who are from PA managers and technical staff as well as community wardens

description.narrative: Ratio of total PA budget spent on field operations raised to narrow spending gap

comment.narrative:
10 of PA revenue
spent on field operations

30 of PA revenue
spent on field operations

192 in 2014
According to the financial scorecards the total revenue is US13054000of which spending on operations and infrastructures are respectively US2514000 and US10540000 The field operational cost of PAs accounts for 192 of the total expenditure in 2014 This ratio would be fluctuant in terms of the amount of infrastructure investment of PAs sponsored by the central government

description.narrative: More representative PA system approved with most of major vegetation types represented gt5 coverage in the NNRs

comment.narrative: 13 of 30 habitats

22 of 30 habitats
addition of desert and Qilian montane habitats with an overall increase of 18000000 ha in the provincial PA system

Wildlife and Nature Reserve Management Bureau of Qinghai Forestry Department thought that the provincial PAs Development Plan 20112020 has covered with more representatives of ecoregion and vegetation types in which some targets have been achieved Instead they prefer to develop Qinghai PA monitoring plan which is consistence with State Forestry Administrations funding strategy and the strengthening of PAs management effectiveness is one of GEF projects priorities In terms of this consideration GEF sponsored the development of Qinghai PA monitoring plan and PMO asked a specialist to conduct a mapping analysis between vegetations and existing PAs in 2015 which indicates the representatives of vegetations and ecoregions in Qinghai and gaps of PAs coverage and also includes the recommendations to future PA system planning

22 of 30 habitats
addition of desert and Qilian montane habitats with an overall increase of 18000000 ha in the provincial PA system

Wildlife and Nature Reserve Management Bureau of Qinghai Forestry Department thought that the provincial PAs Development Plan 20112020 has covered with more representatives of ecoregion and vegetation types in which some targets have been achieved Instead they prefer to develop Qinghai PA monitoring plan which is consistence with State Forestry Administrations funding strategy and the strengthening of PAs management effectiveness is one of GEF projects priorities In terms of this consideration GEF sponsored the development of Qinghai PA monitoring plan and PMO asked a specialist to conduct a mapping analysis between vegetations and existing PAs in 2015 which indicates the representatives of vegetations and ecoregions in Qinghai and gaps of PAs coverage and also includes the recommendations to future PA system planning

description.narrative: Reduction in illegal incident cases within the NRs egpoaching illegal harvesting illegalgrazing etc

comment.narrative:
Currently no monitoring system in place
Baseline for the number of illegal incidents will be estimated at onset of the project

Functioning policing records system with links to police court cases and an enhanced policing mandate of NR staff
Routine report forms designed for numerical analysis
Incidents reduced to 50 of the baseline level

According to the annual report of Forestry Police Bureau of QFD illegal incidents were respectively as follow
2011 1942 cases in total consisted of 34 criminal cases and 1908 administrative cases
2012 1968 cases in total consisted of 22 criminal cases and 1946 administrative cases
2013 1872 cases in total consisted of 24 criminal cases and 1848 administrative cases
2014 1199 cases in total consisted of 56 criminal cases and 1143 administrative cases

description.narrative:
Strategic plans prepared for PA institutions and procedures and investment and PA staff numbers dramatically increased
Permanent staff
Temporary staff

comment.narrative:
No strategic plans
160
5

Strategic Plan developed and adopted
360
150

Permanent Staff 231
Temporary staffContracted273
According to the official document provided by Personnel Division of QFD there is an increase of 118 staff in PA staff who are mainly forestry policemen of SNNR and QFD as well as staff of Qilian Mountain NR and an increase of 273 in contracted staff Ecological public service positions during the year of 20132014 Major reason is based on nature reserve institutional strengthening strategy plan of Province in order to enhance enforcement of PA management and forestry management GEF promoted the process of the strengthening plan through nature reserve management plan development and offered advice on nature reserve institutional strengthening

description.narrative: Provinces system level PA financing increased to close the existing annual financing gap of US 46 million for basic expenditure scenario tracked with PA financial sustainability scorecard

comment.narrative: US 2 million year
US 66 million per year

US193 million per year
According to financial scorecard in 2014 The total revenue of PA system was respectively US283million US193 million in 2011 and in 2014 Of which 721 million is field operational fee and 1054 million is an investment for infrastructure construction The financial data of 7 nature reserves is only available since the other nature reserves dont have discretionary authority independent financial accounts The reason for financial increase are investment from the central government includes infrastructure capacity building conservation Research and publicity and education and other investment from external cooperative research and ecotourism
GEF levers cofinance from the government together to made its contribution of 237million to PAs
US 66 million per year

US193 million per year
According to financial scorecard in 2014 The total revenue of PA system was respectively US283million US193 million in 2011 and in 2014 Of which 721 million is field operational fee and 1054 million is an investment for infrastructure construction The financial data of 7 nature reserves is only available since the other nature reserves dont have discretionary authority independent financial accounts The reason for financial increase are investment from the central government includes infrastructure capacity building conservation Research and publicity and education and other investment from external cooperative research and ecotourism
GEF levers cofinance from the government together to made its contribution of 237million to PAs

description.narrative: Mainstreaming PA management into provincial development and sector planning process
Threats to PAs from infrastructure placement roads dams and other adverse forms of land use avoided mitigated or offset leading to more effective conservation in Qinghais PA system covering 251665km2

comment.narrative: No procedure in place to deal with incompatible developments
Official standards for infrastructure development and operation within the PAs are developed and operationalised with clear rehabilitationoffset mechanism

Transportation and Traffic Infraconstruction Environmental Protection Regulation and Technical Guidelines and Infraconstruction Environmental Protection Regulation of State Grid Qinghai Company and Technical Guidelines was reviewed and will be enacted in 2015
Official standards for infrastructure development and operation within the PAs are developed and operationalised with clear rehabilitationoffset mechanism

Transportation and Traffic Infraconstruction Environmental Protection Regulation and Technical Guidelines and Infraconstruction Environmental Protection Regulation of State Grid Qinghai Company and Technical Guidelines was reviewed and will be enacted in 2015

description.narrative: PA system and its management mainstreamed within the provincial sectoral and development planning framework at the provincial level indicated by clear inclusion of due consideration and concrete measures for biodiversity conservation and PA development as well as ear marked budget in the sectoral development plans at provincial levels and in the national 13th 5year plan

comment.narrative:
No sectoral plans integrate PA objectives
Development plans include no vision and development plan for PAs and no link is made between the PAs and development nor no concrete measure for biodiversity conservation

At least 3 sectoral plans integrate consideration of PAs and of biodiversity conservation measures
13th FiveYear Plan recognises clear linkage between PAs and provincial development and includes PA and biodiversityrelated targets and budgets

15 model was formed that stands for Provincial 13th FiveYear Plan 1 Provincial Development and Reform Commission 13th FiveYear Plan of Land Resources 13th FiveYear Plan of Agrohusbandry Department 13th FiveYear Plan of Water Conservancy Department13th FiveYear Plan of Environmental Protection Department 5 13th FiveYear Plans were integrated with BSAP through intersectoral advisory group that was facilitated by GEF project

At least 3 sectoral plans integrate consideration of PAs and of biodiversity conservation measures
13th FiveYear Plan recognises clear linkage between PAs and provincial development and includes PA and biodiversityrelated targets and budgets

15 model was formed that stands for Provincial 13th FiveYear Plan 1 Provincial Development and Reform Commission 13th FiveYear Plan of Land Resources 13th FiveYear Plan of Agrohusbandry Department 13th FiveYear Plan of Water Conservancy Department13th FiveYear Plan of Environmental Protection Department 5 13th FiveYear Plans were integrated with BSAP through intersectoral advisory group that was facilitated by GEF project
